Pre-Game Insights: Canada is ranked 49th in the world and 11th among teams at Copa América 2024
Argentina is ranked first in the world and the reigning World Cup champions
Argentina has a 50-15-6 record under manager Lionel Scaloni
Canada has played two pre-tournament friendlies, drawing with France 0-0 and losing to the Netherlands 4-0
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the first match of Copa América 2024 for both teams
The match will be played at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, Georgia
Others: This is the first competitive game for Jesse Marsch as the coach of Les Rouges
Argentina has already played six games in qualifying for the 2026 World Cup, and they’re 5-0-1
Twenty-one of Argentina’s current squad were at the World Cup in Qatar
Nobody is coming to this article to learn who Messi is. Perhaps the greatest player of all time, he remains the captain and face of the Albiceleste
For Argentina, anything less than three wins from three games in Group A would be considered a disappointment
Canada, of course, remain hopeful of getting into the knockout stage, and even a defeat here wouldn’t dash that dream — provided they can turn it around against Chile and Peru
Several Canadian players have played against such high-level competition at club level, and plenty more aspire to do so in the next few years
Canada proved they can match up against the best in their draw with France
To get a result, Canada likely have to be perfect, or thereabouts
Stranger things have happened though, and nothing can be taken for granted in international football
With the eyes of the world upon them, could Canada rise to the occasion and deliver something truly special?
